metadata.title: CVE-2019-20811 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 5.0.6. Inrx_queue_add_kobject() and netdev_queue_add_kobject() innet/core/net-sysfs.c, a reference count is mishandled, akaCID-a3e23f719f5c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-20811` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-190-generic - 4.4.0-190.220
linux-image-4.4.0-190-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-190.220
linux-image-4.4.0-190-lowlatency - 4.4.0-190.220
linux-image-4.4.0-190-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-190.220
linux-image-4.4.0-190-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-190.220
linux-image-4.4.0-190-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-190.220
linux-image-4.4.0-190-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-190.220
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-190-generic - 4.4.0-190.220
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-190-lowlatency - 4.4.0-190.220
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-60-generic - 4.15.0-60.67~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-60-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-60.67~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-60-lowlatency - 4.15.0-60.67~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-60-generic - 4.15.0-60.67~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-60-lowlatency - 4.15.0-60.67~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1080-kvm - 4.4.0-1080.87
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1114-aws - 4.4.0-1114.127
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1047-aws - 4.15.0-1047.49~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1056-azure - 4.15.0-1056.61
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1041-gcp - 4.15.0-1041.43
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1022-oracle - 4.15.0-1022.25~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1139-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1139.148
No subscription required

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-190.220').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-60.67~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1080.87').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1114.127').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1047.49~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1056.61').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1041.43').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1022.25~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1139.148').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1143.152').
